events.name: Learning Web Development with Ruby on Rails Lesson 1 - Getting Started
events.description: Want to become a web developer? We are running a eight weeks course to train you into a professional web dev. We teach the skills you need to kickstart your career as a developer and a lifelong learner. From programming fundamentals to launching full-stack web apps, you'll learn to solve problems with code while applying industry best practices in a collaborative environment. This is the first lesson for our Ruby on Rails Web Development Immersive course. We will be teaching you how to get started with Ruby on Rails and set up your local environment.  For this lesson, you must bring along your own computer (any system) and be prepared to learn how to write code and build websites!
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore

events.name: Sunday Showcase: Sustainable Idealism²
events.description:
Sunday Showcase
Sustainable Idealism²: Designing a Sustainable Future
Saturday & Sunday, 26 & 27 Aug | 10am - 7pm
ArtScience Galleries, Level 4
Free. Register in the Lobby

Embracing a transformational mindset in making the world a better place through design, the showcase by BeyonDesign Centre at Temasek Polytechnic is a thoughtful reflection of sustainable design practices, with many projects resulting from collaborative initiatives.

Workshops
Gift Packaging Workshop (1 hour)

Saturday 26 August – 2pm 
Sunday 27 August – 2pm

Get hands-on with paint as the students of Temasek Junior College take you through the various ways you can create your own gift packaging from used envelopes. 

Envelopes are provided but feel free to bring your own. 

Free, registration required 

Bag Charm/Key Ring Workshop (1 hour)

Saturday 26 August – 3pm 
Sunday 27 August – 3pm

Experience the joy of creating bag charms and key rings with Ariel Chen, jewellery designer and creator of Ariel C.  Using materials such as cardboard, newspapers, cotton and hemp yarns, this special workshop incorporates the use of crafting techniques like traditional Kumihimo Braiding and the basics of how to do a simple image transfer for craft design.

Materials are provided but feel free to bring your own. 

Free, registration required 

Fabric Pouch Workshop (1 hour)

Saturday 26 August – 4pm 
Sunday 27 August – 4pm

Upcycle old fabrics with textile artist, Andy Toh from Temasek Polytechnic’s School of Design, using simple cutting and sewing techniques to transform old fabrics into one-of-a-kind sling or drawstring pouches. Andy will also demonstrate other unique ways you can use pre-loved fabric to create laptop cases, cushion covers and more. 

Fabric is provided but feel free to bring your own. 

Free, registration required 
...
Sponsored by Coca Cola

events.name: EML Ableton Live Workshop (Sem 1 Year 17/18)
events.description:
If you enjoy electronic music and you’re a student or alumni of NUS (National University of Singapore), EML is the place for you!

Even if you missed Student Life Fair 2017, or you couldn't make it for the Welcome Tea! You still have a chance at kickstarting the flame that is your Electronic Music Production Journey.

The workshop will go through how to use Ableton Live and basic Electronic Music Production.

Learn how to join the workshop and find out more over at http://www.eml.org.sg/workshop/ now!

Email us at electronicmusiclab@gmail.com for an enquiries.
events.location: NUS UTown, Stephen Riady Centre, Level 3, Conference Room 2, , Singapore
